member.name: T:Cocktail.DesignTimeViewModelLocatorBase`1
member.summary: Base class for a design time ViewModelLocator.
member.remarks:
To implement a concrete ViewModelLocator for your project, extend from this class and override the CreateEntityManager() method. Return an instance of type subclass of DesignTimeEntityManagerProviderBase.
Add references to all the view models in the module or application and by adding the following lines of code for each ViewModel. Implement a Start() method to initialize the ViewModel.
public CustomerListViewModel CustomerListViewModel { get { return new CustomerListViewModel().Start(); } }
In Silverlight and WPF, place the ViewModelLocator in the App.xaml resources:
<Application.Resources> <designTime:ViewModelLocator xmlns:designTime="clr-namespace:your-namespace" x:Key="ViewModeLocator" /> </Application.Resources>
Then use:
d:DataContext="{Binding Source={StaticResource ViewModelLocator}, Path=ViewModelName}"

member.name: T:Cocktail.ISampleDataProvider`1
member.summary: Interface for a SampleDataProvider. SampleDataProviders are used during design time and by FakeStoreEntityManagerProviders to provide sample data. Multiple SampleDataProviders are supported. The Framework will discover all providers and combine the sample data. Each SampleDataProvider must be exported in order to be discovered by the framework.
member.typeparam: The type of EntityManager supported by this SampleDataProvider

code.title: Static export of a SampleDataProvider
code.description: Illustrates how to statically export a SampleDataProvider

code.title: Dynamic export of SampleDataProvider at runtime
code.description: Illustrates how to programatically inject a specific SampleDataProvider at runtime.

member.name: M:Cocktail.ISampleDataProvider`1.AddSampleData(`0)
member.summary: This method is called by the EntityManagerProvider to initialize the EntityManager cache with sample data. Use EntityManager.AttachEntities or EntityManager.CacheStateManager.RestoreCacheState() to populate the cache with sample data. The latter is useful to popluate the EntityManager with previously saved data.
member.param: The EntityManager that needs to be populated with the sample data.

member.summary: The ObjectManager allows for the creation and sharing of multiple object instances at runtime. It utilizes weak references to automatically free instances that are no longer used anywhere in the application. It automatically creates new instances for keys that are being encountered for the first time or after a previous instance with the same key has been released.

member.name: T:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2
member.summary: Represents a dictionary which stores the values as weak references instead of strong references. Null values are supported.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.Add(`0,`1)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the dictionary.
member.param: The key.
The value.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.ContainsKey(`0)
member.summary: Determines if the dictionary contains a value for the key.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumerator over the values in the dictionary.
member.remarks: As objects are discovered and returned from the enumerator, a strong reference is temporarily held on the object so that it will continue to exist for the duration of the enumeration. Once the enumeration of that object is over, the strong reference is removed. If you wish to keep values alive for use after enumeration, to ensure that they stay alive, you should store strong references to them during enumeration.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item from the dictionary.
member.param: The key of the item to be removed.
member.returns: Returns true if the key was in the dictionary; return false otherwise.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Attempts to get a value from the dictionary.
member.param: The key
The value
member.returns: Returns true if the value was present; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes all keys and values from the Dictionary.

member.name: M:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.CleanIfNeeded
member.summary: Perform cleanup if GC occurred

member.name: F:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2._gcSentinal
member.summary: Serves as a simple "GC Monitor" that indicates whether cleanup is needed. If _gcSentinal.IsAlive is false, GC has occurred and we should perform cleanup

member.name: P:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.Item(`0)
member.summary: Retrieves a value from the dictionary.
member.param: The key to look for.
member.exception: Thrown when the key does exist in the dictionary. Since the dictionary contains weak references, the key may have been removed by the garbage collection of the object.

member.name: P:Cocktail.WeakRefDictionary`2.Count
member.summary: Returns a count of the number of items in the dictionary.
member.remarks: Since the items in the dictionary are held by weak reference, the count value cannot be relied upon to guarantee the number of objects that would be discovered via enumeration. Treat the Count as an estimate only. This property also has the side effect of clearing out any GC'd refs.
